page.title: 01Summary of the area.
page.content: The area around the village of Beverstone is sparsely populated.The main village is Beverstone and although it contains an ancient castle and church there are no shops,schools or public houses. In the south of the area is the tiny hamlet of Hookshouse.The housing outside these two settlements consists almost entirely of large,prosperous farmhouses. The countryside is attractive rolling farmland with large fields interspersed with patches of deciduous and coniferous woodland.The only sign of non-agricultural activity in the area is the remains of a wartime airfield. The only main road in the area -the A.4153 links the A.46 with the local centre of Tetbury.
